info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 9:34AM EDT until August 23 at 10:15AM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
At 934 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated light to occasionally moderate rainfall moving across the Charleston Peninsula. The combination of additional heavy rainfall and the incoming elevated high tide, the risk for widespread flooding in Downtown Charleston continues. City emergency management officials are reporting over 20 road closures in Downtown Charleston due to a combination of fresh water and salt water flooding. The number of road closures will likely increase. Avoid travel in this area.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Downtown Charleston, West Ashley, Medical University Of South Carolina, The Citadel, Marion Square and Columbus Street Terminal.
This includes I-26 between mile markers 220 and 221.
info.instruction: High tide will inhibit runoff of heavy rain, flooding areas of poor drainage in Downtown Charleston. Areas most prone to flooding include the Market, Crosstown, East Bay Street and Morrison Drive.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR CHARLESTON COUNTY
